content.question: Which of the following Lewis diagrams represents the substance that would exhibit the most significant hydrogen bonding in a pure liquid sample?

choices.label: The figure presents a Lewis electron-dot diagram. Two C atoms, an O atom, and two more C atoms are connected to each other with single bonds. The rightmost and leftmost C atoms are each connected to three H atoms with single bonds. The other two C atoms are each connected to two H atoms with single bonds. The O atom has two nonbonding pairs of electrons.

The figure presents a Lewis electron-dot diagram. Five C atoms are connected to each other with single bonds. The rightmost and leftmost C atoms are each connected to three H atoms with single bonds. The other three C atoms are each connected to two H atoms with single bonds.

The figure presents a Lewis electron-dot diagram. The diagram shows a row of 3 C atoms connected to each other by single bonds. The leftmost C atom is connected to three H atoms with single bonds. The middle C atom is connected to two H atoms with single bonds. The rightmost C atom is connected to two H atoms and one N atom by single bonds. The N atom is connected to two H atoms with single bonds. The N atom has one nonbonding pair of electrons.

The figure presents a Lewis electron-dot diagram. The diagram shows 3 C atoms connected to each other with single bonds. The left C atom is connected to 3 H atoms by single bonds. The middle C atom is connected to an O atom by a double bond. The O atom has two nonbonding pairs of electrons. The right C atom is connected to 3 H atoms by single bonds.

content.answer: The figure presents a Lewis electron-dot diagram. The diagram shows a row of 3 C atoms connected to each other by single bonds. The leftmost C atom is connected to three H atoms with single bonds. The middle C atom is connected to two H atoms with single bonds. The rightmost C atom is connected to two H atoms and one N atom by single bonds. The N atom is connected to two H atoms with single bonds. The N atom has one nonbonding pair of electrons.

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
